snippet: The Philadelphia 76ers’ new owners, a group of private equity titans, is committed to turning around the N.B.A. franchise on the court and at the gate.
abstract: Philadelphia 76ers’ new owners, a group of private equity titans, are committed to turning around the NBA franchise on the court and at the gate; since taking over, Josh Harris and his executive team have cut ticket prices, reached out to fans and built a workmanlike, successful team; Harris also hired Philadelphia native Adam Aron to be the chief executive, co-owner and the face of the team.

byline.original: By KEN BELSON and PETER LATTMAN

lead_paragraph: The Philadelphia 76ers’ new owners, a group of private equity titans, is committed to turning around the N.B.A. franchise on the court and at the gate.

headline.seo: Sixers Are the Latest Play for Private Equity Turnaround Artists
headline.main: Things Money Can and Cannot Buy Revive the 76ers
headline.print_headline: Things Money Can and Cannot Buy Revive the 76ers
